item.title: Handmaid's Tale
item.description: Lesson 1 Dystopia introduction (see powerpoint : list the elements) Extract one (chapter 1 : The Red Centre) Read chapter 1 and analyse key quotes Analyse the quotes from chapter 1 with the doublesided handout Lesson 2 Extract 2 (chapter 3 : Meeting Serena Joy) Recall extract 1 with Red Centre drawing Video : Offred meets Serena Joy https://www.youtube.com/watch?time%5Fcontinue=2&v=9Hj-fjrtClM&feature=emb%5Flogo Do the discussion between Commander Waterford and his wife, Serena Joy.

item.title: Much ado about Nothing
item.description: Chapter 4 [Expression et Construction de soi : expression des émotions] What are you going to learn in this chapter? Lesson 1 Introduction : Ten Shakespeare stories Hamlet Romeo and Juliet Othello Richard II Richard III Henry IV Macbeth Merry Wives of Windsor Much ado about Nothing Comedy of errors Introduction : Shakespeare’s language Worksheet to teach the specific vocabulary that is different in modern English and in Shakespeare

item.title: Debating
item.description: Chapter 3 [Art et débat d’idées : l’art du débat] What are you going to learn in this chapter? The qualities needed to be good at debating and convincing people with language The usefulness and role of debating Some famous debating from American history Lesson 1 Document 1 : Jefferson and Hamilton Document 2 : Cabinet battle N° 2 Lesson 2 3 Documents (Study of a practice file for the exam) 12 Angry men script Online debating critique Devolved parliament, Banksy Table produced in class to help with analysing a file

item.title: Minimal art
item.description: Chapter 2 [Art et débat d’idées : l’Art qui fait débat] What are you going to learn in this chapter? You will learn about a famous British painter (Turner) You will learn vocabulary to talk about art and painting You will learn about minimal art You will learn to express your opinion about art You will learn to express your reactions
